. It is part of the town, Monte Argentario, in the province of
(the most populous) is one of the two major towns that form Monte Argentario.

The historic core is enclosed within its walls, which were erected by Siena in the Renaissance, on pre-existing structures. 

The Palace of the Rulers overlooks the picturesque Piazzetta Santa Barbara, which overlooks the harbor. The building, built in the sixteenth century, preserves the facade in Renaissance style of the past.  The building housed the Spanish rulers, and at the opposite end of the square on the side that looks towards the sea, is the fifteenth bastion of Santa Barbara. 

Worthy of note is the Giardino Corsini, in which there are many rare tropical and subtropical botanicals. 

The country is dominated by the mighty fortress Aldobrandesca, a fortification built on several occasions between the Middle Ages and the Renaissance around existing structures.
There are many places where someone can eat in Porto Ercole. However, being in Italy, I usually prefer to go and eat a good pizza. My favorite place is

which does many diffrent types of freshly baked pizzaz, bread and cakes. Cakes can be asked to be made for someone in specific. Next to the pizza shop is another pizza shop, and I enjoy both equally, but a warning. These places are usually packed during the summer from 10am to 1230pm.
